newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends lower on fund outflow.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends lower on fund outflow.

text.p: Taiwan dollar ended down against its U.S. counterpart on Saturday due to an increase in the outflow of foreign funds during the final half-hour of trade, dealers said.
The local unit finished lower at T$27.631 against Friday's T$27.625 close. Turnover through dealers was a slow US$45.5 million. A $27.60-66 trading range was seen in the near term.

"The market was pretty quiet in the morning and demand of the greenback only started to rise in late trade after some foreign investors moved their funds out of Taiwan's stock market," a foreign bank dealer said.
